intro: Halenia purdieana var. congesta, commonly known as the clustered halenia, is a striking plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This variant is distinguished by its dense, clustered inflorescences, which give it its common name.
